reviews.review_msg: Dr. Pickup is a fair, clear professor who makes an otherwise complicated course easy to understand. However, the second half of the course is SIGNIFICANTLY harder than the first half! It was blended, so my recommendation is to go to the in-person lectures for that part of the course. Assignments were all doable and marking was generous.

Well, I overall think that he is a decent professor, but in most situations, the TA plays a much more important role than him. I am not sure if this is because the course is online or if there are other reasons for it.
Confusing course, no overlap between lectures and tutorials. Felt like two different courses.

Mark's recorded lectures were the only thing needed to learn the course content. He used many examples and explained almost every concept clearly. His in-person tutorials were helpful but not necessary. Overall good professor.

The lectures were delivered remotely, with tutorials, midterm and final in person. He provided a practice test for the midterm, which really helped as most of the questions were similar to the actual midterm. He also gave us a catchup week and a reading week which was super helpful to students who were behind. I would totally recommend!

Lectures were long and sometimes hard to get through but Mark adjusted the class well to an online learning environment and was very accessible. TB is provided but is honestly useless outside of the small assignments because the midterm/final were straight out of the lecture slides. One of the few classes I recommend taking online.

Mark was great, I had no background knowledge and was very anxious to take a math heavy class  but he made it simple. I still had to work pretty hard to do well, but unless you completely slack off, you should be able todo okay. His exams are straight forward, he gives practice tests which are very similar. If I had to take a class with him again

Hes an excellent prof, just be sure to read the lecture slides before class and you'll do great. His lectures are very informative, so unless you contextualize the info, you may get a little lost at times.

Overall he's a great prof. He tries to keep stats as entertaining as possible. I found his examples made the material less intimidating and easier to understand. You should definitely read the chapters being discussed before attending the lecture though.
He makes his notes unnecessarily complicated... takes a lot of time to decipher what he means to say.

Brenda was a great prof in my opinion.  Not easy but if you make a fair effort to do the readings you will do fine.  Extremely helpful and is happy to spend time after class to help with concepts, or just to discuss what is on your mind.  Overall I enjoyed her class and would love to take another with her.

Teaches the mandatory class well.  Most aren't interested in stats or research methods, but like another reviewer here has said, he really does make the best of it.  He kept my interest during the semester and it's too bad he doesn't teach outside of this stream of Poli Sci or I'd be willing to take him for another course for sure.
nice guy, good lectures, making stats interesting is not easy. warwick does a good job at keeping things alive
this prof makes the best of a boring course, people only take it as it is a major req.  Prof is helpful and explains material well and offers extra help if needed.

If you put effort into the class you will do good. Warwick is extremly helpful and will help explain concepts. However, Warwick goes off on too many examples which confuses what he is trying to teach. Moreover, sometimes it is hard to understand what he is saying, reading the text is essential.

Really helpful. He realizes that his course is more math oriented-- and you generally shouldn't mention the 'm' word to arts students, but he does an awesome job explaining everything. Is also very willing to give you extra help. He definitely has a high level of interest in his course, and he wants to share his enthusiasm with the students.
Good prof just a lot of coding. He has an online textbook which is nice and the labs were helpful. Overall he's okay but be aware of the midterm because the average is usually around a 50%.

I like Steve, I do but dam his version of Pol 201 is very tough. Compared to another professor who teaches the course it is like night and day as Steve's class is all about code and coding. His midterm consists only of terms and concepts so you need to memorize equations but there is no math to actually do.

Weldon wants his students to do well, but hesitates to help with certain questions as he wants students to figure it out themselves. Tutorials were very useful, lectures not so much. He does give extra marks for attendance sometimes. Overall not a bad prof.

This is probably the most dreaded mandatory course for poli sci students because it's stats and R based. Hard course but you get the grade you put in work for. Labs are much harder than assignments but are pass/fail and meant to push your understanding of the material. Steve is very approachable for help and a super understanding prof.

Love this prof. He really wants his students to pass and will do what ever needs to be done to make it happen, although if your not attending class/tutorial then don't expect the respect in return. He definitely makes you work for your grade, heavy on homework and not a lot of time between assignments, definitely a good prof to take a class with
This class is the most difficult class and Steven and the ta's have no marking criteria. They give the mark they want to who they want. very difficult course would not recommend
Horrible.

Steve is probably one of the most approachable profs I've ever had at SFU. He replies to emails very quickly. Don't expect to pass this class especially if you don't work hard. POL201 was probably one of the harder courses I've taken, but he makes it tolerable with his humour and 24/7 access for help.

There is little reading but you will need to reread the texts over and over if you hate math or coding. You will need to spend lots of time on the assignments and start them early so you can ask him for help unless you are good at math.  Final was basically testing for statistical significance easy! Only people good at math should attempt to cram.

This class was very hard. When lectures weren't cancelled they made no sense and did not relate the the course material whatsoever. The course is basically 100% R so the only useful part of the course was the lab. Weldon did not care if students struggled in his class and did not offer much help. Do not take this course with Weldon.

Steve is 100% the best prof I've ever had at SFU. I  have never had a prof give so much help! He has made me love stats (which I didn't think was possible). As long as you work hard, go to see him in office hours if you have a question, and always practice in R, you will be totally fine! Amazing knowledge, understanding, and commitment to students.

Weldon is super funny and tries to make class exciting. He is confusing during lecture but if you talk to him he is super helpful. He made stats easy if that is even possible.VERY FAIR MARKER! I didn't know anything in this class ended up with an A- because i did all the work! If you gotta take stats do it with Weldon!

Weldon is a very fair marker and he makes the course bearable. He is very enthusiastic about what he teaches and makes the material interesting. One really needs to do the homeworks and make an effort, and you're guaranteed a good mark. Weldon teaching POL 201/IS 240 I would recommend to anyone who has to take this course :).
Great Professor. Know his stuff. Hardworker. Always respond to questions. Good luck Steve. You are amazing.

If you go to Weldon's class. If you do the Homework assignments. This is an EASY course. Just do your work. For gods sake, he gives bonus marks if you attend lecture all term! Just go. Do your work. He's so helpful.

Weldon is such a great prof! I've had him for 201 and 231 and he is by far the most interesting and funny prof I've had so far. He's very helpful and responds to emails quickly. He is a hard marker, but is readily available for help and questions.
Had to take this class, it was hard work but Weldon knows his stuff.

no one actually likes stats... but steve makes it awesome. by far one of the best profs i've ever had! highlight of my week was the hour spent in lab with him. he jokes around and the class is really laid back... yet you still learn what you need to. marking is fair, based on effort in assignments. totally worth having him as a prof!

Sadly the field of political science focuses too much on stats as a preferred methodology.  If you have any issues with stats at all consider the commentary here.  I would not recommend this course to anyone.

Great Proff ! Who is enthusiastic about what he teaches. I hate math but had to take this course, he made in intresting an easy. Lectures were a bit pointless as you could just read th powerpoint, but then you miss his attempts at funy jokes which are always worht laughing at.
Lectures were utterly pointless. Followed the power-point to a tee.  Class involved more work than was necessary, and you were expected to memorize intricate text-based computer commands.

Is completely rude when you see him during his office hours. He only seems interested in helping you if you email him, and even then, if the question cannot be answered in a couple sentences, he'll say "sure that's ok". Not worth the trouble, wait until another prof is teaching the course.

Lectures were clear and interesting for a course most of the class have no interest in. The exams were difficult, but fair, and the assignments were marked mostly on effort. Overall Weldon does a commendable job.

He's kind of like the "House" of Political Science, but not as cranky and doesn't have a limp.  What is similar is that they can both be condescending sometimes.  But what they also have in common is that if you were to ask them questions, you better know what you're talking about and the question better not be something stupid.
Prof. Weldon course is interesting given the topic (who likes stats anyway). My take is that he did a good job overall.
This guy is unbelievable.  The worst prof ever.

I agree with the more recent posts. POL 201 is hard, but the prof is simply fantastic. Easily my favourite in the dept. He is so enthusiastic and helpful. I've never had a prof hold so many office hours (like 10 per week!) or respond to e-mail so quickly. I hate math, but he actually made stats fun. Can't wait to take another class from him!
He's hard as heck, and sarcastic but helpful if you approach him.  Those who say he's argumentative may want to examine their own attitudes first.

I am not sure why there is hatred of this prof. I found him to be very helpful, he is obviously very passionate about Poli Sci. Everytime, I needed extra help he was accomodating, but do not expect him to hold you hand. Admittedly, he is one of the hardest markers I have come across, but what can we expect we are not in high school anymore.

I agree with the other reviews, this prof is really bad.I can't believe he got hired in the first place, i hope the department looks at the class reviews of his teaching abilities as they are really very bad.  He was not helpful in any way, and always gave students who needed help a lot of attitude.This class was the bigest waste of money and time
No Comments

I had him for a T/A in a course taught by Steven Weldon. If Josh is teaching 201 now I'd recommend him over Weldon ANY day. Every time I asked him a question he seemed confused, but eventually came up with an answer after some research. Shows he actually cares.
Super nice and cares about his students.
nice, fair marker, made it at least somewhat bearable considering it was a dry pol stats class

A god among Professors, a beam of light in this drab, dreary world of Academic Professors. The man is humble, kind, knowledgable and patient. WHAT MORE DO YOU GUYS NEED? TAKE ANY CLASS WITH THE NAME R. HANLON NEXT TO IT!

Prof Defne's class was boring I will admit it but I believe this class is boring because of the material and there is little Defne could have done to change that. She is an amazing prof, quick and fair marker and provides a lot of feedback if u choose to ask. There is a lot of homework in this class but easy to do. Took the class online cause COVID

I took this course online due to Covid-19. Although this course was work heavy, Professor Ezgi was incredibly understanding and adapted her deadlines multiple times as we adjusted to courses online. She also responds quickly to emails and is always willing to help. One of my favourite profs at SFU for sure!

YOU DON'T NEED THE BOOK but Defne is a good prof. Follow along in the lecture, pay attention, & do the homework. She cares and she does want everyone to understand things before moving on. I got 70% on everything but I got an A because she added bonus marks to tests and she went over questions then quizzed us right so we could get a good mark.

I think a lot of the negative reviews here are directed towards the course rather than the prof. Defne is super sweet and is always willing to help with whatever you need. Go to lab!!!! It's the only way you'll pass.
A really intelligent and passionate professor. The course itself is hard but she does really want you to succeed. Dont even bother buying the textbook though, it is useless.

The course itself is really tough. Stats and coding are not my thing but Defne is an absolutely wonderful professor. Shes caring, energetic, and wants to help us pass. Super helpful with office hours and through email. The only two complaints I have is that the final was harder than expected and the textbook isnt useful at all.

Midterms are completely unrealistic. Punishes students for making a small mistake by having 4 parts to a question where getting the first part will get you all 4 but if you make a mistake at the start you will not get marks for the next 3 parts even if the student understands what to do.

Hard class, but a very kind and energetic prof. If you aren't a math person like me the homework assignments and take home final are a saving grace. She is always willing to help if you ask questions. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! Midterm was a bit long for the time given. Make friends in the class!

Textbook is useless, labs are unrelated to the lectures, have to learn coding on top of math for assignments. Lessons relevant to homework assignments are taught the day of the due date, most times. The midterms are too long to write in only 1 hour, with no support from the prof.

Ms. Ezgi seemed unable to understand why anyone would struggle within her class, and taught accordingly. She blazed through topics and skimmed over practice questions without a care. The mandatory text was useless and caused more confusion than anything else. I would highly recommend that you do not take a statistic based class with Ms. Ezgi.

WOW- Defne is amazing. Very approachable, knowledgeable and helpful. She clearly wants her students to succeed and is more than willing to help you do so. She's fun and energetic too. If she can make me understand statistics, she must be amazing! Don't be afraid to get help from her, she's so personable and smart. 10/10. She's a new hire- go sfu!

The class itself was a nightmare for me, being as I hate math. I thought it was a pretty difficult class. However, he is very helpful and encourages questions and clarity. He is a fair marker as well. I believe this course would have been far worse for me with a different professor.
Great prof. Knowledgeable and always available for help.
He tries but ultimately fails.

Besides his French accent which was hard to understand, he was useless with facts and seemed very flustered when he taught.  I have not had him for any other Pol class, but hopefully he is better at teaching facts than Stats. I do not recommend taking a class with him if it is a required component for you degree.
